snippet: In a peaceful corner of Helmand Province, poppies grow in plain sight, directly taxed by a government ever more deeply involved in the drug trade.
abstract: Afghan government officials, are, more than ever before, directly involved in opium trade, competing with Taliban in controlling poppy production, drug manufacture and resulting enormous revenue; growing government involvement undercuts years of anticorruption efforts, with United States having spent over $7 billion in past 14 years to battle Afghan opium production  (Series: The Opium War).

byline.contributor: Fazl Muzhary contributed reporting from Marja, Afghanistan; Nad Ali, Afghanistan; and Garmsir; and Taimoor Shah from Garmsir.

lead_paragraph: In a peaceful corner of Helmand Province, poppies grow in plain sight, directly taxed by a government ever more deeply involved in the drug trade.

headline.print_headline: Tasked With Combating Opium, Afghan Officials Profit From It
